1. Igniting Insight ‚Äî What Exactly Is Why‚ÄëFires?

A full‚Äëstack, open‚Äësource web platform that transforms raw satellite fire detections into interactive stories, statistics, and forecasts. Built for researchers, analysts, policy‚Äëmakers, and the simply curious, it turns NASA FIRMS MODIS & VIIRS hotspots (2001‚Äëpresent) into meaningful narratives.

2. Spark of Motivation ‚Äî Why Did I Start This Project?

  • Personal catalyst: Growing up in wildfire‚Äëprone regions made me curious about the patterns behind the smoke.
  • Data gap: Existing dashboards showed where fires occur but rarely why and what next.
  • Skill synergy: Combines my background in data science, geospatial analytics, and full‚Äëstack engineering.

3. Building the Blaze ‚Äî How the Stack Comes Together

Layer Tech Highlights
Frontend React + Plotly + Mapbox GL
Backend Flask REST API on DigitalOcean (Docker, Gunicorn)
Data Pipeline Python ETL ‚Üí Parquet on Cloudflare R2
ML Sandbox PyTorch / LightGBM notebooks served through FastAPI micro-services

4. Three Pillars of Fire Intelligence

üó∫Ô∏è Seeing the Blaze ‚Äî Interactive Data Visualization

  • Drag‚Äëand‚Äëzoom world map with monthly/weekly/day sliders
  • Country & biome filters, density heat‚Äëmaps, and choropleth
  • Hover‚Äëtooltips with instant statistics (count, area, confidence)

üìä Reading the Flames ‚Äî Deep‚ÄëDive Statistical Analysis

  • Country‚Äëyear dashboards: fire counts, burned area, seasonality curves
  • Box‚Äëplots & violin charts for intensity distributions
  • Correlation matrix comparing fires vs. climate indices (ENSO, drought)

ü§ñ Predicting the Spark ‚Äî Machine Learning Forecasts

  • SARIMA & Prophet for short‚Äëterm regional trend forecasts
  • LightGBM gradient boosting for feature‚Äërich prediction (climate + land‚Äëuse)
  • KAN (Kernel Attention Network) experimental model for spatial‚Äëtemporal transfer learning

5. Lighting the Way ‚Äî Who Uses Why-Fires?

  • Researchers & Meteorologists ‚Äì Validate climate models against real burn data
  • Policy‚ÄëMakers & NGOs ‚Äì Allocate firefighting resources and craft prevention policy
  • Data Enthusiasts & Educators ‚Äì Explore patterns for coursework and public awareness
  • AI Developers ‚Äì Plug‚Äëin ready datasets for novel predictive models

6. Roadmap ‚Äî Where the Fire‚Äôs Heading Next

  1. Better performance of Machine learning model(light-weight, precise and fast response)
  2. User‚Äëuploaded layers (e.g., local weather stations, vegetation indices)
  3. Alert Service ‚Äì email/webhook when probability > X % for chosen region
